metadata.name: Shape Study  #154
metadata.description:
“Everyone has their own shape.”
We meet shapes of all kinds in our life.

Algorithmic randomness generates shapes ever so slightly different yet similar. 
I suppose these are someone’s collection.

“Why do they need to have so many similar things?”

Perhaps it’s their versatility in the pleasure they could bring.
Perhaps they’re meant for different occasions.
Perhaps some are left to search for their very own shapes.

Seeing this, I realized that when people explore themselves or others, it is also a form of shape study.
With what’s visible and concrete, explore the unseen and abstract.

However, good shapes only come by chance.
Shapes, in truth, cannot be good or bad in and of themselves. It’s only when two shapes come together that the meaning thereof arises.
I hope you who decide to pick up this work will find the shapes to your liking.

『每個人都有自己的形狀』
並且每個人一生中也會認識各種形狀

程式的隨機性讓我產生的每個形狀都相似而不同
我想像這也許是某個人的蒐藏
『為什麼會需要擁有這麼多相似的道具呢？』

也許是它們有著不同的功能，能帶來不同的愉悅；
也許是適用於不同的場景
也許是遲遲未找到屬於自己的形狀

想像至此，我意識到：當人們探索自己／他人的同時，也可以說是一種形狀研究
用一個看得見的具體，去探索一個看不見的抽象

然而，好的形狀是可遇不可求的
其實形狀本身沒有好壞，只有當兩個形狀相遇時，形狀才有了意義
希望蒐藏這件作品的各位都可以遇到喜歡的形狀


--------------

# Paramaters
theme:
- Faithful
- The Epic
- On the wall
- Waiting Line
- Get Lost
- Born to be a player
- Looks rare
- The Beautiful Colors

colors:
- Sketch
- Plaster (4 variations)
- Stone
- In the Dark
- Transparent (2 variations)
- Contrast (2 variations)

juicy:
- Dry
- Humid
- Flood

# Other
Double click to download the image.


Sorry for some parents. The NSFW switch is not implemented yet, but I have to release this now.

metadata.name: Dreamcatcher Forest #179
metadata.description:
"Dreamcatcher Forest" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at Art Basel, Basel 2022. The illustration in this work draws inspiration from Native American dreamcatchers, a protective talisman crafted from beautifully intricate patterns of woven thread, built from natural materials & colorful beads.

Dreamcatchers are used to protect dreamers while they sleep. Good dreams are able to slip through the web to meet the sleeper beneath, while bad dreams are trapped and prevented.

- Use the "S" key to save a PNG image.
- Use the "P" key to export a print-quality image.

metadata.name: Bored Computer Screen #300
metadata.description:
"Bored Computer Screen" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at Art Basel, Basel 2022


Bored Computer Screen (BCS) is a direct descendant of Specter👻pixel⬛latte☕, where the central idea is agent and displacement. In BCS, there are agents—the small moving circles—that get their colors ripped away by the surrounding pixels. Though they occur on the same screen space, they are separated in their own cells, a simultaneous multiverse of sorts. In some iterations, a very clear voronoi pattern will appear. I didn't consciously strive for this look. It's what naturally happens, when you try to divide space, so that the borders occur exactly in between the closest neighbor. When I first saw this pattern emerge, I wanted to see how far I could get the distinct cells to influence each other. The idea that the same algorithmic processes can happen many times but still separately in a single piece has always interested me (and explored in the Infinite Browse series). BCS is an extension of that, albeit a little more chaotic.

Note:
- Best experience on browsers and devices with support for WebGL2 

Made by Sam Tsao (@sam___tsao) with P5, P5Fbo and perlinjs.

attributes.name: A More Descriptive Number of Cells

objkt.name: Urban Building: Where Are We Going? #50

metadata.name: Urban Building: Where Are We Going? #50
metadata.description:
This is a building generation made by pure code.

Urbanization at the almost everywhere in the world has stepped into an accelerating phase in last century. Buildings bring magnificent achievements and represent the human power over nature. But, following these tall and crowd buildings one by one, where are we going?

In this work, I generate different types of building with a special viewpoint, which represent different concepts of states we are going to. Hope you enjoy these varieties and coincidences.

Variables:
- 4 modes
- 4 environments
- 3 orbs
- 3 building density
- 3 building structures

Please be patient with drawing process.

issuer.name: Urban Building: Where Are We Going?

metadata.name: Flosalis N24° #421
metadata.description:
Flosalis is where generative flowers grow!

- Press "S" to save an artwork.
- Collectors who own this NFT have the right to print the work.
Made with p5js.

metadata.name: Mythologic #159
metadata.description:
"Mythologic" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

Mythologic is a project derived from cloud series, Cloud Atlas and Requiem: Cloud on fxhash. In the series, lines and circles are used in an organics movement like Cloud Hands, which is a move of Tai Chi. Practitioners move their hands slowly and smoothly, make circles and rotate with extreme concentrating. In Chinese we said “floating clouds and flowing water” to describe calligraphers’ freely flowing style of writing. Chi is a very important for oriental artists, and for genart as well. In the series, lines and circles start from one position to another, and develop with organic rotations and movements, like practicing Tai Chi on the canvas. 

Mythologic was inspired from “Classic of Mountains and Seas”, also known as Shan Hai Jing, is a Chinese classic text and a compilation of mythic geography and beasts. 

“There is a beast that looks like a fox with nine tails.” 
“Huangbei: it is a beetle with meat like a tadpole, but with a head and a tail” 
“The beast has the body of a fish but the wings of a bird” 

There are many incredible creatures in the text which describe the oriental fantasy. The idea of Mythologic is to present an illustrated handbook with random generated paintings, each one is like a framed badge, to memorize the glorious age. It uses the "cloud hands" technique in every parts of this piece, the center, the circle and the frame. They are all the same algorithm but perform variety with different density and components. Gold, Silver, Copper, Jade and Ruby colors as noble symbol of treasure in Chinese culture. 

This project use p5js. 

Press 'S' to save pictures.

Thanks to the support of Yi-Wen Lin in this project.

metadata.name: Herbarium #169
metadata.description:
"Herbarium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

Occasionally, I stumble upon vintage scientific illustrations on various topics, exotically looking charts and graphs, alternative layouts for the periodic tables or psychological research diagrams, elaborate illustrations of botany and zoology, minerals, and natural and sometimes unnatural phenomena. Most of those illustrations are part of the "art and science" practices from the 18th and 19th centuries. At the core of those practices were observation and interpretation, unraveling complexity through visualizing abstract ideas or finding a creative approach for understanding previously incomprehensible forms. 

I'm an admirer of two female pioneers in the field. Maria Sibylla Merian created, with immense dedication, a book with intricate illustrations of plants and insects, later praised by scientists. On the other hand, Anna Atkins published a book with beautiful botanical cyanotypes, considered the first book with photographic images. These topics are the visual inspiration for pieces presented at ArtBasel HK. 

My mathematical background makes me naturally attracted to graphs, converting numbers to curves, and everything schematically displayed. Also, combining scientific symbols and illustrations with imaginary data inspires the spectator to find meaning in unrelated or random things or provokes latent skepticism towards assumed concepts of truth, reality, and knowledge.

metadata.name: Microgravity #612
metadata.description:
Microgravity is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

Scale symmetry of abstract semiliquid forms.

Click on a section of the image to explore deeper.
- Use keys [0-9] to change the detail level.
- Use the "S" key to save a PNG image.
- Use the "R" key to reset the coordinates.

metadata.name: Orcz Dungeons #274
metadata.description:
Mint your own Orcz Dungeon for free!
There is a 25% chance that you will get a free whitelist spot on our upcoming pfp project!

Project details:
Orcz is a collection of 1,000 hand-drawn NFTs on the Tezos blockchain.
There are 0% royalties so you will keep 100% of the secondary sales!

How to claim your whitelist spot:
Click on the chest and it will open, if it says "Whitelisted!" then you have earned a free whitelist spot on our upcoming project! Just join our discord and post your Tezos address + your generative token's link in #free-whitelist

Twitter: https://twitter.com/OrczNFT
Discord: https://discord.gg/z6FMrpKBAN

(!) All secondary sales will be donated to the Processing Foundation.

metadata.name: Eyeshadow Roses #469
metadata.description:
"Eyeshadow Roses" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

Painterly roses randomly overprinted with heavy streaks of ink. 

The roses grow by a sequence of three spirals, every new spiral smaller and superimposed on the former.  After the roses are fully formed, a random mask of heavy ink is algorithmically screened over the flowers in a pattern of horizontal or vertical lines, occasionally fully flooding the painting. The accumulation of choices evokes graffiti or printmaking. The sequence of choices are interpreted by the computer according to the algorithm. The beauty of these choices are determined by the viewer.

Each piece takes roughly 10 seconds to generate.

Artist: @sarah_ridgley
Press [s] to save the image
JavaScript / p5js | script size: 11kb

metadata.name: Heat Death #621
metadata.description:
Heat Death is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

It aims to produce variation and detail from minimal logic.

The source code uses p5.js and consists of around 180 lines of code. It has been left unminified for the interested viewer to learn more.

metadata.name: Beacon #9
metadata.description:
Thousands of glowing beams, each with its own gradient and disappearing to a path of vanishing points. While the inspiration was figurative, drawn from the Northern Lights, the results have been taken to the abstract. Bold shapes in the foreground draw focus and their simple geometries are elevated to a signal. 

This project was created during a Speed Run over ~24 hours.
Uses WEBGL and may load a little slowly on some machines.

metadata.name: EYES #196
metadata.description:
The beauty and soul of eyes have always fascinated me. There are billions of eyes in the world, all with different colors, textures and shapes and each one is still unique. With this project, I wanted to capture that natural beauty of the eyes, but also give them my unique colorful style.

Zombie and Cat eyes are more rare. Who will collect the Zombie Cat eye?

----

Created with the help of amazing cables.gl. For optimization purposes, in order to make the project load properly on fxhash, I had to use 2 textures for the eye pupil shapes instead of procedurally generating them. There is also hdr map loaded for the reflections.  

Press E to download the generated image.

----

All who collected NEBULAE were added to the reserve list. <3

metadata.name: CryptoLandscape #72
metadata.description: Landscape with algorithmically generated mountains, with precipitous drops, great peaks and data clouds
